paragraphs.body: Fortress Fight 2 is a game hosted on Nick.com that is also available on the Android Market.
paragraphs.text: Fortress Fight 2 is a game hosted on Nick.com that is also available on the Android Market.

paragraphs.body: The goal in Fortress Fight 2 is identical to that in its ${link_0}; the player has to destroy his or her opponent's fortress before their own is destroyed.
paragraphs.text: The goal in Fortress Fight 2 is identical to that in its predecessor; the player has to destroy his or her opponent's fortress before their own is destroyed.

paragraphs.body: All actions are performed through the left mouse click.
paragraphs.text: All actions are performed through the left mouse click.

paragraphs.body: Players can choose from one of three fortresses: ${link_0}, ${link_1}, or ${link_2}.
paragraphs.text: Players can choose from one of three fortresses: Water Tribe, Earth Kingdom, or Fire Nation.

paragraphs.body: There are three fortress types available to choose from, each of which is represented by the three thriving nations of the Avatar World: the ${link_0}, ${link_1}, and ${link_2}.
paragraphs.text: There are three fortress types available to choose from, each of which is represented by the three thriving nations of the Avatar World: the Water Tribe, Earth Kingdom, and Fire Nation.

paragraphs.body: Once one of these fortresses has been selected, the game chooses one of four locations that will become the battlefield. Each of these fields has specific advantages and disadvantages that affect both fortresses.
paragraphs.text: Once one of these fortresses has been selected, the game chooses one of four locations that will become the battlefield. Each of these fields has specific advantages and disadvantages that affect both fortresses.

paragraphs.body: Each building that is a part of the fortress has a unique ability that is capable of turning the tide of any battle; however, as that structure is worn away by the bombardment of an enemy fortress, its functionality decreases until, once totally destroyed, it is no longer of any use. A list of the structures (excluding the main fortress building) and their abilities is as follows:
paragraphs.text: Each building that is a part of the fortress has a unique ability that is capable of turning the tide of any battle; however, as that structure is worn away by the bombardment of an enemy fortress, its functionality decreases until, once totally destroyed, it is no longer of any use. A list of the structures (excluding the main fortress building) and their abilities is as follows:

paragraphs.body: Here is a ${link_0} fortress' repair/replenishment screen upon the first level's victory. Note that ${link_1} is acting as a representative.
paragraphs.text: Here is a Fire Nation fortress' repair/replenishment screen upon the first level's victory. Note that Zuko is acting as a representative.

paragraphs.body: At the end of each succeeding battle in single-player mode, a screen will appear that allows the player to spend ${link_0} that his or her character has acquired through the course of the game, on the repair of the fortress' exterior and the replenishment of weapon supplies.
paragraphs.text: At the end of each succeeding battle in single-player mode, a screen will appear that allows the player to spend gold pieces that his or her character has acquired through the course of the game, on the repair of the fortress' exterior and the replenishment of weapon supplies.

paragraphs.body: Every time a player executes an attack, the image of that nation's most prominent character appearing in ${link_0} of ${link_1} is shown. That character will glow when the fortress launches the chosen attack. Players who choose a Fire Nation fortress are represented by ${link_2}; those with a Water Tribe fortress by ${link_3}; and those with an Earth Kingdom fortress by ${link_4}.
paragraphs.text: Every time a player executes an attack, the image of that nation's most prominent character appearing in Book One: Water of Avatar: The Last Airbender is shown. That character will glow when the fortress launches the chosen attack. Players who choose a Fire Nation fortress are represented by Zuko; those with a Water Tribe fortress by Katara; and those with an Earth Kingdom fortress by Aang.
